message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning) as it discusses the use of deep learning tools for graph-based semi-supervised learning. Additionally, the paper proposes new approaches to train graph convolutional networks (GCNs) and evaluates them through extensive experiments, which are typical of the machine learning subfield. 

The paper also touches upon the topics of artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and computer vision (cs.CV) as it discusses the mechanisms and limitations of the GCN model, which is used for image classification tasks. 

Furthermore, the paper mentions natural language processing (cs.CL) as an example of a domain where GCNs have been applied successfully. 

Finally, the paper proposes co-training and self-training approaches to train GCNs, which are techniques commonly used in the subfield of neural networks (cs.NE).
